{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3020260,"name":"Mr.Robby","username":"Mr.Robby","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr.robby/{size}/8579_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-09T22:27:38.046Z","cooked":"

Hi all. We are starting Labview this year, and have gotten and Autonomous and Teleop written well thus far. What our question at this time however is, when a button is pressed to enable our climber, is there a way to turn off our Pump, so it doesn’t draw the amperage away from our climbers?

Our current Teleop Program looks something like this, and was aiming to have the Pump stop upon activation of the Climber motor:

Screen Shot 2022-03-09 at 4.26.29 PM1072×844 38 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2022-03-09T22:27:38.046Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":254,"readers_count":253,"score":120.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":405232,"topic_slug":"stop-pneumatic-pump-in-teleop","display_username":"Mr.Robby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/a/6/a67e4b9f18a64f4cb1dec09eadb70086672a82df.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26241,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/stop-pneumatic-pump-in-teleop/405232/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3020272,"name":"Mark McLeod","username":"Mark_McLeod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_mcleod/{size}/65145_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-09T22:45:46.596Z","cooked":"

The compressor menu is here:

Compressor menu1167×252 34.3 KB

Open it in Begin.vi
Then call Stop when you want it to be off (it assumes Start but you can call that in Begin.vi to be explicit).
It doesn’t really start/stop the compressor. Start only allows the compressor to be automatically controlled by the Pneumatics Hub/Pneumatics Control Module. While Stop doesn’t allow it to be turned on.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2022-03-09T22:48:03.746Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":51.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":405232,"topic_slug":"stop-pneumatic-pump-in-teleop","display_username":"Mark McLeod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/9/c/9cf6b473cbcb751893295db8147707b400f3ac07.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2123,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Itinerant Troubleshooter"},"post_url":"/t/stop-pneumatic-pump-in-teleop/405232/2","custom_user_title":"Itinerant Troubleshooter","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3020604,"name":"Mr.Robby","username":"Mr.Robby","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr.robby/{size}/8579_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-10T16:53:59.231Z","cooked":"

Thanks for showing us where the Compressor tab is.

Is there a way to make it deactivate during a button press by chance? or - to deactivate in the last 20 seconds of Teleop so we can use full power with our motors?

Again still fairly fresh and new to Labview and looking for insights.

Thanks!

Edit:
Not in front of robot atm, but this is what we came up with? Would this seem logical?

Edit: I just reread your statement… of your first post. The start stop doesn’t necessarily turn power off of the compressor… it just prevents it from being turned on again…

I was hoping we could find a way to actually turn off the compressor, because our Amp Draw is so great, that it’s hindering our climb mechanism now.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2022-03-10T22:09:49.749Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":16.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":405232,"topic_slug":"stop-pneumatic-pump-in-teleop","display_username":"Mr.Robby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":2123,"username":"Mark_McLeod","name":"Mark McLeod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_mcleod/{size}/65145_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26241,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/stop-pneumatic-pump-in-teleop/405232/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3020823,"name":"Mark McLeod","username":"Mark_McLeod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_mcleod/{size}/65145_2.png","created_at":"2022-03-10T22:12:15.447Z","cooked":"

The compressor should turn off.

I just tested the second method and it works (I changed button “8” to “6” so I can use the “back” and “start” buttons on an xbox controller-in the Driver Station USB slot 0).

Here’s the project, so you can see if it works for you.
2022temp.zip (2.5 MB)

P.S.
Actually, both methods work together. I just had to cut the Teleop time down to a more testable 40 seconds.

After some frustrations, we found out that after updating to the newest version Firmware and also a recent Labview Update, the Compressor Off now works.

Thank you!
